oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Partnership of organic farming, eco-tourism and wilderness conservation – experiences of the pilot project "New Thracian Gold" in Bulgaria
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Popov, Vladislav H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
Social aspects
Networks and ownership
Produce chain management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The "New Thracian Gold" project is working in the Eastern Rhodope region of Bulgaria to alleviate migration and rural stagnation by establishing and testing a pilot model of partnership of partnership between organic farming, ecotourism and wilderness conservation. First results shows increasing number of certified organic farms, combined with local eco-tourism, new markets and increasing annual income of rural population.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Popov, Vladislav H. (2013) Partnership of organic farming, eco-tourism and wilderness conservation – experiences of the pilot project "New Thracian Gold" in Bulgaria. Paper at: IFOAM Organic World Congress 2014, Istanbul, Turkey, 13-15 October 2014. [Completed]
